result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Joseph Vinopal was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert Joseph Vinopal is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert Joseph Vinopal was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample if one is not on file.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.
Court deems def eligible for Good Time.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Joseph Vinopal

records.addlTxt: 2:19 p.m  Court calls this case and 22TR89.  Def appears in person.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of WI.  Per Parties, plea agreement has been reached.  Stip on TR/Court accepts.  Amends TR to "illegal turning" with $175.30 and 60 DTP.  Def agrees.  Def pleads NC.  Court orders as indicated.  Court then proceeds to 22CF11.  Court questions def re probation.  Court addresses parties.  Def understands.  Court goes through rights with def re atty benefits.  Def states money is an issue.  Court advises doesn't want def to waive right to atty because of money.  DA addresses court.  Court addresses parties again.  Def still wants to proceed without atty.  Def knows how atty can help.  Court questions def further.  Def knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waives right to atty.  Court accepts waiver.  DA makes MTD Counts 1 & 3.  Court grants motion.  Court goes through constitutional rights.  No coercion to enter agreement.  Def pleads NC to Count #2.  Court finds FB for guilty finding.  Def understands and agrees.  DA agrees.  Court accepts plea and finds def tuilty.  Sentencing:  DA recommends $443 and 3 days ICJ.  Vic rights complied with.  Def addresses Court.  Wants to enlist in the Marines.  Sister is present.  Sister speaks on behalf of def.  Indicates def is doing well.  Court accepts recommendation.  Bond to be returned.  Court imposes $443.50, 3 days ICJ, 60 DTR, DNA sample if not on file.  Good time.  Adj.  2:41 p.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 20, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

09:25 AM Defendant Robert Joseph Vinopal appeared by phone means. Prosecuting Atty Matthew J Tingstad appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def explains absence in person.  Court advises whill have to be present in person.  Case to be rescheduled for 6/20 at 2:15 p.m.  Court advises will have to get warrant if not present.  Adj.  9:29 a.m.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:16 a.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  DA updates Court.  Was planning to offer plea-close to resolving.  Set for PLEAS on 6/15/22 at 9:00 a.m.  Court:  Def needs to be present in person.  Adj.  11:19 a.m.  Clerked by wmg/typed by klr
Status conference on May 13, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 20, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:40 a.m.  Court calls case.  Def present.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Public def info given to def.  Def going to represent himself today.  Def has received complaint and has read.  Waives Court reading.  Court explains prelim and time limits.  Def wants prelim but willing to waive time limits.  PTC to be set for March 16th at 9:00 a.m.  Court advises def can get atty at any time throughout process.  Adj.  10:46 a.m.  klr

VINOPAL, ROBERT:  02/14/2022 BOND/PC HEARING:  1:15 p.m.  Court calls case, cites appearances.  Def appears, in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appears for the State of WI.  Court has been given filed PC.  Heidi Brewer makes special appearance for def today.  Def acknowledges receipt of PC statement.  Atty Brewer has also recieved.  DA states vic rights are complied with.  No abusive contact with Jaclyn, not to possess any firearms, and cash bond continued.  DA has no argument for more or less than already requested.  

Atty Brewer responds.  Court had temporarily set $2,000 pending hearing today.  Atty Brewer requests def be briefly questioned.  Has not had opportunity to talk to def.  Court questions def re where he lives.  Def to be going back to home.  DA believes this was discussed and def is going back to home.  Def understands is going to previous  home.  Def indicates he just lost employment.  

Atty Brewer has no objection to no abusive contact.  Requests a higher signature bond.  Court questions def re ability to post.  Def indicates does not have any money.  Someone would have to post for def.  Danielle V. who is present, states she would post bond.  DA asks Court to ask def if probation hold.  ICSD to check on P-hold.  Def states that he believes there is and was told he would have to talk to PO this week.  

Court indicates there is a TRO involving same person who is vic in this case.  Concern is that def would be violating if returning to home.  Court questions if DA has spoken with vic regarding same.  DA does not have a clear answer.  DA understood no abusive contact.  Court advises Order is no contact in restraining order.  ICSD there is a P-hold.

Court sets $1,000 cash bond set.  No contact with vic or victims.  Restraining order will need to be resolved.  No firearm possession, no contact with either vic in restraining order and PC statement.
